headline.main: Coalition Doubted; Plan for United States of Europe Held Visionary

lead_paragraph: TO THE EDITOR OF THE NEW YORK TIMES: As Count Coudenhove-Kalergi said in his letter last Sunday, he created the "Paneuropaeische Bewegung" (Paneuropa Movement) in Vienna in 1922. One might say that the idea to put an end to the contrasts and antagonisms that have existed for thousands of years among the European peoples is about as obvious as, perhaps, the idea to put an end to the plague.
